greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = least k such that prime(n) + A002110(k) is prime.
comment: Conjecture: every prime number can be written as +- p(n) -+ p(k)# where p(i)=i-th prime, p(i)#=i-th primorial.
The sequence grows remarkably slowly. The largest number occurring within the first 50000 elements is 90. - _Stefan Steinerberger_, Apr 10 2006
a(1) = 0 is the minimum value of a(n). It is also unrepeated in this sequence. - _Altug Alkan_, Dec 02 2015
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (corrected by Ray Chandler, Jan 19 2019)
maple: primorial:= proc(n) option remember: ithprime(n)*procname(n-1) end proc:
for k from 0 do if isprime(p+primorial(k)) then return k fi od:
program: a(n) = {k=0; while(!isprime(prime(n)+primo(k)), k++); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 27 2015
results.author: _Pierre CAMI_, Dec 30 2004
ext: a(1) = 0 added and name edited by _Altug Alkan_, Dec 02 2015
